question:
Deployment Manager license error:
DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag
answer:
Error: Tag's configuration information cannot be retrieved.
The DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag.

Resolution:

1. Open Deployment Manager (DM).
2. Click the Gear icon in the top-right corner.
3. Select Product Key from the menu.
4. When prompted, enter the product key PERF2197.
5. Verify the status shows 'Active Product Key' with a valid date.

Once activated, Deployment Manager will support managing tags using TED and BLE.

question: How to RMA
answer:
On the ticket, click "Change to RMA".

Pick Product Solutions Returned – RTLS or Patient Security (based on product).

Set RMA Type to Unk unless you know the correct value.

Assign the ticket to the RTLS Sales Operation queue for RTLS.

For Patient Security, assign to the appropriate Sales Ops group (WG, Arial, etc.).

question: Batch Reporting Tool for log file
answer:
Windows System Report (MobileView) — Batch Tool

What this captures

• MobileView logs and Apache logs
• Windows Event Logs (System, Application, etc.)
• Installed programs, running tasks, and startup items
• Firewall rules, IP configuration, and netstat snapshot
• Windows Update history
• AeroScout ProgramData/AppData artifacts (e.g., Instant Notifier, client logs)
• Hostname and timestamp included in the output filename for clear identification

Location of the tool
On the MobileView server:
<MobileView Install Dir>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\

File name
WindowsSystemReport.bat

Internal Engineer Procedure (demo for staff)
1. Log into the MobileView server (RDP or console) with administrator rights.
2. Browse to:  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait while the tool collects logs and creates a ZIP file.
5. Locate the output ZIP file on the Desktop.
6. File naming format:  HOSTNAME_logs_v1.8_YYYYMMDD_HHMM.zip
7. Upload the ZIP file to the support ticket.

Customer-Facing Instructions (copy/paste)
Subject: MobileView — Windows System Report (log collection)

Hi,

Please run the built-in Windows System Report tool on your MobileView server and upload the results:

1. Sign into the MobileView server using an administrator account.
2. Navigate to the following folder:
  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait for the process to complete (a ZIP file will appear on the Desktop).
5. Attach the ZIP file to this support ticket.

This tool is read-only. It collects MobileView and Apache logs, Windows Event logs, installed applications, and network/system information to help us troubleshoot issues efficiently.

question: Find Asset Location via reporting tool
answer: OBS nice video on finding device location via saved reports

question: Infant Exit Alarm Triggered After Baby Returns to Protected Area
answer:
Symptom:
Customer reports that when a baby in Transport Mode returns to the protected area and Transport Mode is dismissed,
an Infant Exit alarm is triggered after several minutes.

During investigation, logs are filled with the following error -
2025-11-11 ERROR <asset-manager> com.aeroscout.mobileview.healthcare.cache.PatientCacheImpl
UnitZone was not found in ZoneToUnitZoneCache. zone ID=1310 unitZone ID=50

Solution Details:
A defect has been identified and is scheduled to be fixed in version 5.8 MR2.
Defect ID: 107555
Description: MV - Hugs: The infant cannot be discharged because the Unit and MAP have already been deleted.
Attempting to perform the discharge results in an MV-000 exception.

Workaround:
To stop the recurring errors in the logs:
Open all infant cards in the Hugs UI.
Verify that each infant has an assigned Unit.
If any infant does not have a Unit, add one and save the card.

question:
Ticket 336467
Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW
answer:
Issue Summary:
Customer is unable to configure or update firmware on T15e tags running firmware 2.4 using Deployment Manager (iOS) version 5.6.8.4.
When connecting to the tag, Deployment Manager displays a pop-up message stating that only partial information is available for the tag.
Configuration pages are visible, but changes cannot be made, preventing firmware updates and SSID/key configuration.

Email Thread / Investigation Details:

From: Gidon Lissai <Gidi.Lissai@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, December 15, 2025 12:27 PM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Firmware update from the Deployment Manager is supported starting with T15e firmware version 2.5.13. Refer to the T15e release notes for confirmation.


From: Kevin Clayburne <Kevin.Clayburne@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, December 15, 2025 1:23 PM
To: Gidon Lissai; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

I have been helping a peer with a similar ticket. The customer is using Deployment Manager (iOS) version 5.6.8.4 with a T15e running firmware 2.4.
When clicking the tag image and opening the three-dot menu, the Firmware Update option is missing. This previously worked after guidance provided in October.
I reproduced the issue by rolling my own T15e back to firmware 2.4 and confirmed the firmware update option is no longer available.
After upgrading the tag to firmware 2.5 via MobileView, the firmware update option became available again.


From: Gidon Lissai <Gidi.Lissai@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 28, 2025 8:02 AM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

The root cause has been identified. This issue exists with T15e/h/ms firmware version 2.4 and below. It will be addressed in the next Deployment Manager version planned for Q1 2026.
The workaround described below works as expected and allows tag configuration and configuration file upload if needed.


From: Gidon Lissai
Sent: Monday, October 27, 2025 8:10 AM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Suggested workaround: Configure the tag without performing a Get Configuration first. Select the tag by pressing the tag image,
press the More (three-dot) menu, and choose Configure. This opens the configuration screen with default or new settings.


From: Kevin Clayburne <Kevin.Clayburne@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, October 27, 2025 7:04 AM
To: Gidon Lissai; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Customer reports they are unable to configure T15e tags running firmware 2.4 using the latest Deployment Manager.
When connecting to the tag, a pop-up appears stating that only partial information is available.
Configuration pages are accessible but cannot be edited, preventing firmware updates and SSID/key configuration.
A similar issue is being tracked under ticket 336376. An image of the message box was attached for reference.

Conclusion / Resolution:
Firmware updates from Deployment Manager are not supported for T15e firmware 2.4 and below.
Firmware upgrade capability becomes available only after upgrading the tag to firmware 2.5.x or later via MobileView.
A permanent fix is planned for a future Deployment Manager release in Q1 2026.

question:
Aeroscout Links Repeat Alerts Function
Not Operating as Expected
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: Links
Version: 5.8.20 and earlier
Date Created: September 10, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00333549

Symptom:
The repeat alerts feature is not functioning correctly. During testing on a lab system, only a single alert was received, whereas multiple alerts were expected.

Problem Description:
Repeat notifications were tested on the following asset within the organization "Kennan’s Pilot Kit" using the Links platform:

Asset Details:
Asset Name: Sterile Processing 23
Location: 2nd Floor Table
Device MAC Address: 000CCC1EBF69
Reported Value: 70°F
Normal Range: 50°F – 60.1°F
Threshold Time: 0 Minutes

The reminder job responsible for generating repeat alerts ceased functioning, resulting in only one alert being issued instead of the expected recurring notifications.

Solution:
The issue was resolved by restarting the rules-processing server hosted in AWS.

question:
HUGS Authentication Clients Disconnect
Displays MobileView Error Message
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and earlier
Date Created: August 24, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00329229

Symptom:
HUGS Authentication Clients intermittently disconnect, resulting in a white screen accompanied by a generic MobileView error message.

Problem Description:
Authentication clients occasionally display a white screen with a generic error message. This behavior appears to be random and is associated with Event ID 61003 from the source "Application Frozen."

The error message indicates that the event description cannot be found, suggesting that either the relevant component is not installed or the installation is corrupted. The message advises installing or repairing the component on the local machine.

If the event originated from another computer, the display information must have been saved with the event.

Event Details:
Application Name: MobileView Client Loader.exe
Path: C:\Program Files (x86)\AeroScout\Authentication Client\MobileView Client Loader.exe
Version: 5.7.20.180
Process ID: 3788
Window Title: Authentication Client
Start Time: July 25, 2025, 1:17:09 PM
End Time: July 25, 2025, 1:17:18 PM
Duration: 00:00:09.073
Resolution: Application was unfrozen

The message resource is present, but the corresponding message was not found in the message table.

Solution:
A patch was provided to the customer and successfully tested on versions 5.7.20 and 5.7.30.

Reference ID: 108490
Fix: Authentication Client – Upgrade of embedded WebView component

question: T15a - Many Missed Transmissions
answer:
Last Updated: December 31, 2025

Product: T15a
Version: N/A
Date Created: December 28, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00318456

Symptom:
Ilko is attempting to set up a demo in the Securitas Office in Korea using the following configuration:

2 × GW3100
1 × EX5500
2 × T15e tags

Alexey and I replicated this test in our lab and observed the same issue: significant packet loss with T15a tags when using GW3100 gateways.

Solution:
The issue will be resolved in the next T15a version, scheduled for release in July 2025.

In the meantime, please ensure you are using the latest T15a firmware and hardware versions.

question:
Instant Notifier
Unclear Error Logged After Removal of Custom Property Used in INF Event Action
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and earlier
Date Created: September 8, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00333100

Symptom:
Following the removal of a custom property that is actively referenced in an INF (Instant Notification Framework) event action, the MobileView server log displays repeated and unclear error messages.

Example Log Entries:

2025-09-03 11:03:49,144 WARN <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.web.core.filters.SessionTimeoutFilter] Session timeout detected, redirecting...

2025-09-03 11:04:07,729 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 22, fieldKey: AssetCP_22

2025-09-03 11:04:07,729 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 20, fieldKey: AssetCP_20

2025-09-03 11:04:07,729 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 25, fieldKey: AssetCP_25

2025-09-03 11:04:07,729 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 24, fieldKey: AssetCP_24

2025-09-03 11:04:07,729 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 21, fieldKey: AssetCP_21

Problem Description:
An exception is logged when a custom property (CP) is deleted while it is still referenced in an active event configuration. This results in repeated error messages in the server log, particularly if the associated alert remains active and is not dismissed.

Reproduction Steps:
1. Create a custom property.
2. Configure an event that displays the custom property in the INF.
3. Trigger the event and confirm the custom property is displayed in INF.
4. Delete the custom property.

Actual Behavior:
If the alert generated by the event is not dismissed, the following error recurs every five minutes:

2025-09-08 11:16:55,829 ERROR <> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.alertingconnector.alert.InstantAlertTemplateGenerator] could not detect custom property definition with id : 20, fieldKey: AssetCP_20

Solution:
Solution details pending.

question: LDAP User Login Latency
answer:
Last Updated: December 31, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and below
Date Created: December 31, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00296862

Symptom:
Customers are experiencing intermittent latency during LDAP login attempts.

Key Observations:
User login hangs for several seconds.
The issue appears to occur across all three LDAP servers, with primary focus on LDAP Server #3 (Vineland DC1 – 10.103.193.1).
The issue was captured during a user information pull from Active MV1 (10.103.192.45). After several attempts, the issue resolved on its own.
Other applications using LDAP were not affected, raising the question of whether the issue was related to MobileView or the customer network.

Testing Details:
Active MV: 10.103.192.45
Vineland-DC1: 10.103.193.1
User: brownk

Test Results:
LDAP user retrieval took more than 60 seconds from 10.103.192.45.

Captured in Wireshark:
Request Time: 16:58:40
Retrieved Time: 17:00:00
Delay: 1 minute 20 seconds

Subsequent tests from 10.103.192.45 showed normal performance, with multiple successful and fast retrievals between 17:08:20 and 17:08:40.

Root Cause:
A patch was provided to the customer based on Defect 104576 to improve LDAP logs and troubleshooting procedures. However, the issue resurfaced due to problems with the customer DNS configuration and SSL certificate.

Solution:
Apply the patch associated with Defect 104576 to enhance LDAP logging and troubleshooting.

Address DNS and SSL certificate issues on the customer side to prevent recurring LDAP login latency.

question: AC Census List Locked and Unusable
answer:
Last Updated: December 31, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.7.20.180 and below
Date Created: December 21, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00323623

Symptom:
The customer admitted 20 HUGS tags for testing supervision alerts. After several days, only 5 tags appeared in the census list.

A server reboot of the MobileView HA configuration temporarily restored the census list and displayed all tags. However, the issue occurred again, causing the census list to become locked and unusable.

Log Evidence:

2025-05-22 09:35:27,931 ERROR <<asset-manager>> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.common.exception.ExceptionTranslator] error performing the operation, Error identifier: #MV-00000003#
org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.el.ContextAwareELException: javax.el.ELException: Error reading [table] on type [com.aeroscout.mobileview.hugs.web.beans.censuslist.CensusListBackingBean]

2025-05-19 13:04:15,313 ERROR <<asset-manager>> [com.aeroscout.mobileview.common.exception.ExceptionTranslator] error performing the operation, Error identifier: #MV-00000002#
org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.el.ContextAwareELException: javax.el.ELException: Error reading [table] on type [com.aeroscout.mobileview.hugs.web.beans.censuslist.CensusListBackingBean]

Solution:
Defect 108490: Authentication Client – Upgrade version of Web View (CYBER).
Fixed in MobileView 5.8 GA.
Patch provided for MobileView 5.7.20.180 and 5.7.30.164.

Defect 108568: Authentication Client – A database restart or temporary disconnection causes the Census List to freeze.
Fix scheduled for MobileView 5.8 MR1.

question:
T15a and T15ah Tags
Release Notes and Firmware Overview
answer:
KB Article: 12997
Release Date: December 2023
Latest Update: September 2025
Revision: Rev G

Overview:
The T15a and T15ah bi-directional environmental monitoring tags are part of Securitas Healthcare’s enterprise visibility solutions. The T15a tag includes a temperature sensor, while the T15ah tag includes both temperature and humidity sensors.

These battery-powered tags support historical log extraction, NIST calibration mode, quick activation and battery replacement, and both audible and visual alerts for critical events.

Main Features:
• Quick activation via push button
• Quick battery replacement
• Buzzer and LED status indicators
• MSCHAPv2 enterprise security encryption
• HTTPS communication with MobileView using TLS 1.2
• Bi-directional connectivity for OTA firmware and configuration updates
• BLE-based configuration via Deployment Manager
• Historical data retrieval for analysis
• NIST calibration mode for temperature and humidity
• Multiple mounting options (tie-wraps, screws, tape)

Tag Models and SKUs:
T15a:
TAG-1500-A – Temperature tag with push button
TAG-1500-A-NIST – Temperature tag with 3-point NIST calibration
TAG-1500-A-POT – Temperature tag with potting container

T15ah:
TAG-1500-AH – Temperature and humidity tag
TAG-1500-AH-NIST – Temperature and humidity tag with 5-point NIST calibration

Accessory SKUs:
TAC-1540 – Mounting cradle (tape, 20 pack)
TAC-1541 – Mounting cradle (zip ties/screws, 20 pack)
TAC-500 – Potting container (20 pack)
TAC-501 – Potting container (single)
TAC-440 – Battery (50 pack)
TAC-441 – Battery (single)
TAC-450 – Battery compartment opener (10 pack)

Firmware Version 1.7.10:
Release Date: July 2025

Key Updates:
• Supports Hardware Versions 1.0 and 2.0 (V2 marked on tag label)
• Temperature range: -30°C to +60°C (-22°F to +140°F)
• Fix for missing messages to MobileView causing graph gaps (no battery impact)
• Double-click event reporting to MobileView
• Local alarm buzzer limited to 15 minutes to conserve battery
• BLE connectable advertisement duration improvements
• Out-of-threshold and back-in-threshold events logged and uploaded to MobileView (5.8+)

Compatibility (v1.7.10):
MobileView 5.6 MR3 and above
Engine 5.6 MR2 and above
Deployment Manager iOS 5.6.7+ (iOS 16+)
Deployment Manager Android 1.3.1.13+ (Android 10+)

Known Issues (v1.7.10):
• Certificate names longer than 50 characters are not accepted
• Humidity accuracy may degrade over time at high temperatures (e.g., 40°C)
• T15ah humidity variance may exceed 6% in certain ranges
• Local alarm sound may stop after long button press
• AP layout must strictly follow RTLS deployment guidelines to avoid missed messages

Earlier Firmware Versions:
v1.6.4: Fixed Cisco AP9130 BD session issues and host failover resolution problems.
v1.6.1: Initial firmware release.

Reporting a Bug:
Bugs and feedback can be submitted through the Securitas Healthcare Support portal.

Users Can See Alerts They Are Not Permitted to View

question: Unable to Upgrade MobileView Due to a Space Character in the TEMP Folder Path
answer:
Last Updated: December 17, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and below
Date Created: December 17, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00343041

Symptom:
During the MobileView upgrade process, the following errors were observed:

2025-12-15 08:09:59 Old MV version is 5.6.4.118
2025-12-15 08:09:59 Failed to find classes by the substring PreUpgrader_ in the jar C:\Users\fong%20doug\AppData\Local\Temp\WZSE3.TMP\setup.jar
2025-12-15 08:09:59 java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: C:\Users\fong%20doug\AppData\Local\Temp\WZSE3.TMP\setup.jar

Problem Description:
The upgrade fails when the TEMP directory path contains a space character, preventing the installer from locating required files during the pre-upgrade process.

Solution:
Defect ID: 110841
Related Ticket: 00343041 (San Francisco General Hospital)
Issue: Unable to upgrade from MobileView version 5.6.4.118.
Fix: Scheduled for inclusion in the MobileView 5.8 MR2 release.

Workaround:
To successfully complete the upgrade before the fix is released:
• Modify the environment variables related to the TEMP folder.
• Ensure the TEMP folder path does not contain any spaces.

question: Handling Conditions for Zone Status in Dwell Event Specifications
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and below
Date Created: August 24, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00330954

Symptom:
Two alerts are triggered simultaneously for the same asset: one from "number 1_Closed" and another from "number 2_Is Open."

Problem Description:
The customer is attempting to configure a dwell event in conjunction with a specific zone status. Using a T15ms with a door contact, the zone status can be toggled successfully between "Closed" and "Open."

The issue occurs because the dwell event condition is configured to trigger alerts only when the zone status is either "Open" or "Closed." However, MobileView does not correctly enforce this condition and generates both alerts regardless of the configured zone status.

Solution:
Defect ID: 108821
Description: In MobileView Core, the zone status condition that determines whether an alert should be generated does not function correctly for events of the "Dwell" type.

This defect is resolved in MobileView version 5.8 MR1.

Workaround:
Design assumptions indicate that customers who want alerts based on zone status should select the Zone itself (and not the Exciter) when defining the event.

If it is necessary to include an exciter in the event conditions (for example, when the zone is large and contains multiple exciters, but only one is located near a door), the following workaround is recommended:
• Define an inner zone around the exciter and trigger alerts based on this inner zone.

If issues arise involving multiple zones, a more advanced workaround should be reviewed and discussed on a case-by-case basis.

question:
Prevention of Configuration Loss During Upgrades
in the Apache Folder for Secure MobileView
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.8.20 and below
Date Created: August 24, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00331202

Symptom:
During an upgrade from MobileView version 5.7.30.164 to 5.8.20.117, previously applied customizations in the Apache configuration files are lost.

The following changes were reverted to default values:
• httpd.conf – Port 80 reopened (Listen 80)
• monitoredServices.xml – Custom edits overwritten
• httpd-ssl.conf – Secure port reverted from 8443

Problem Description:
After upgrading MobileView from version 5.7.30 to 5.8, all Apache-related settings intended to disable HTTP access and enforce secure communication were reset to their default configurations in the following files:

• httpd.conf
• monitoredServices.xml
• httpd-ssl.conf

Solution:
Defect ID: 108846
Description: In MobileView Core, configuration changes made in the Apache folder for secure MobileView are not preserved during the upgrade process.

This issue is scheduled to be resolved in MobileView version 5.8 MR1.

Workaround:
Before performing the upgrade, document all custom Apache configuration changes.

After the upgrade is complete, manually restore and reapply the custom configurations in the affected files based on their previous state.

question: Report Service Crashing When Running Year-Long Reports
answer:
Last Updated: December 16, 2025

Product: MobileView
Version: 5.6 and above
Date Created: August 28, 2025
Author: Research & Development / Arye Shor

Source Ticket: 00332149

Symptom:
Executing a MeasurementHistoryAuditReport.xml for approximately 50 million records results in an out-of-memory failure and causes the MobileView report service to crash.

Problem Description:
MD Anderson was able to successfully generate one-year reports for a single asset using MobileView version 5.4. After upgrading to version 5.6, running a similar one-year report caused the report service to crash.

Investigation revealed that the value of maxNumOfResults in MeasurementHistoryArchiveReport.xml had been increased from 50,000 records to 50,000,000 records, which exceeded the available JVM memory and resulted in an out-of-memory error.

Solution:
During initial troubleshooting, the report-service JVM maximum memory (XMX) was increased to 6144 MB, which resolved the immediate issue. However, this approach is not recommended and is unnecessary in most cases.

The correct and supported method for increasing the number of rows returned by a report is to use the JMX console under the asset-management service.

Recommended Procedure:
1. Open the JMX console for the asset-management service.
2. Navigate to reportsJMXServiceImpl.
3. Select overrideReportMaxResults.
4. Retrieve the report ID from the report XML.
5. Reload the report templates.
6. Set the required number of records for the report.

Additional Notes:
If an out-of-memory condition persists after applying the JMX override, the report-service XMX memory size may be increased temporarily as needed.

Be aware that MobileView upgrades override JVM memory settings, so any custom XMX value must be reviewed and re-applied after an upgrade.

Reference:
See attached screenshot for JMX configuration example.

question: Managing Multiple ALE Engines, Tag Visibility, and Wireless Tag Certificate Deployment in MobileView
answer:
Overview:
This KB entry documents a review of a MobileView deployment using multiple ALE engines, shared RF environments with neighboring facilities, tag visibility behavior, firmware considerations, and the newer Wireless Tag Configuration feature used for certificate and Wi-Fi configuration management.

ALE Architecture and Map Distribution:
The system uses two ALE engines (ALE1 and ALE2) to distribute processing load due to a large number of maps and large map sizes.

• Approximately half of the maps are assigned to ALE1
• The remaining maps are assigned to ALE2
• Both ALEs connect to the same MobileView servers

This design helps maintain performance and scalability in large environments.

Cisco Connector Verification:
Both ALE engines were verified to be using the same Cisco Spaces / Cisco connector IP address.

• Primary connector was confirmed as connected and healthy
• Successful reconnection status was observed on both ALEs

MobileView High Availability Validation:
The MobileView environment consists of a Primary and Passive (HA) server pair.

• Primary MobileView server is actively connected to the engine through the gateway
• Passive MobileView server correctly shows no active engine connection
• Gateway-to-engine communication was verified as healthy

Tag Communication and Visibility:
The system is actively communicating with deployed tags, primarily T15e tags.

Tags from a neighboring facility may appear in the system due to shared RF coverage and overlapping access points. This behavior is expected in shared or adjacent environments.

Mitigation for Seeing Neighboring Facility Tags:
If unwanted tag visibility becomes an issue, it can be mitigated by changing the Gateway ID:

• Many facilities leave the Gateway ID at the default value (commonly ID 1)
• Assigning a unique Gateway ID (for example, 900 or 2000) ensures only local tags communicate with local gateways
• Tags from neighboring facilities will no longer appear after this change

Firmware Observations:
• T15e tags are the primary tag type in use
• Some tags observed at older firmware levels likely belong to neighboring facilities or are offline
• Latest firmware versions should be applied where applicable
• T15h tags were also identified and require firmware upgrades as needed

Instant Notifier – Chrome Extension:
The Instant Notifier is now delivered as a Chrome browser extension rather than a standalone application.

Key points:
• No separate application installation required
• Appears automatically when MobileView is open in Chrome
• Instant notifications pop up directly in the browser
• Recommended to inform users ahead of upgrades so they are aware of the UI change

Wireless Tag Configuration – Certificate and Wi-Fi Management:
Newer MobileView versions include the Wireless Tag Configuration feature, allowing centralized management of Wi-Fi settings and certificates.

Capabilities:
• Create one or more wireless configuration templates
• Define SSID and Wi-Fi credentials
• Specify application server address
• Attach root certificates to the configuration
• Assign configurations by tag category

How It Works:
• A wireless configuration template is created under Administration → System → Wireless Tag Configuration
• Templates are associated with tag categories
• As bi-directional tags sync, they automatically receive Wi-Fi and certificate updates from MobileView

This eliminates the need to update certificates tag-by-tag using Deployment Manager, which is especially beneficial in large environments.

Important Consideration (Certificate Update Order):
There is an open question regarding update sequencing:

• Whether server certificates should be updated before pushing certificates to tags
• Or whether tags should be updated first before server certificate changes

This is considered a "chicken-and-egg" scenario and confirmation from R&D / Product Management is pending.

Current Best Practice (Pending Confirmation):
• Prepare both old and new certificates in advance
• Update tags first using Wireless Tag Configuration
• Then update server certificates after tag updates complete

Additional Notes:
• Wireless Tag Configuration was not available in some early 5.7 releases but is present in this system’s version
• This feature significantly reduces operational overhead for large deployments
• Deployment Manager remains cumbersome for large-scale certificate changes and should be avoided when possible

Status:
System health, reporting structure, and integrations were validated and found to be operating correctly.
